channel.title: Comments on: SQL Server sprawl, heard it twice in one day
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Don't even start about access :-) What is worst that access is FoxPro, we have literally thousands upon thousands of those on several desktops/servers/workstation/laptops...all used to produce data :-(
item.content:encoded: Don’t even start about access üôÇ What is worst that access is FoxPro, we have literally thousands upon thousands of those on several desktops/servers/workstation/laptops…all used to produce data üôÅ

item.title: By: Reedo
item.dc:creator: Reedo
item.description: Well, look on the bright side: it isn't sprawl of Access **full-body shudder**.
item.content:encoded: Well, look on the bright side: it isn’t sprawl of Access **full-body shudder**.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: I've never heard that term either. My last scan I found two of them again :-( One actually was doing some reporting at that. Luckily it only took an hour to get rid of it and SSRS out the same report for them
item.content:encoded: I’ve never heard that term either. My last scan I found two of them again üôÅ One actually was doing some reporting at that. Luckily it only took an hour to get rid of it and SSRS out the same report for them
